oai_dc:dc.dc:title: .58 caliber rifle made by local gunsmith
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: .58 caliber, cap-and-ball muzzle loader made by gunsmith around 1849 in Townsend, Tennessee. Used by Adam Wilson (1841-1919). He carried it throughout the Civil War. The brass trigger guard possibly made out of brass candle stick. Wilson was a private in Company A, 3rd Regiment Tennessee Cavalry Volunteers. Enlisted on August 10, 1862 and discharged on June 10, 1865.
